articles.author: SEAN MURPHY and JULIO CORTEZ
articles.description: VALLEY VIEW, Texas (AP) — Powerful storms killed at least 18 people, injured hundreds and left a wide trail of destruction across Texas, Oklahoma and Arkansas after obliterating homes and destroying a truck stop where dozens sought shelter during the latest deadly weather to strike the central U.S.
articles.title: Latest deadly weather in US kills at least 18 as storms carve path of ruin across multiple states

articles.author: WAFAA SHURAFA, TIA GOLDENBERG and SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Palestinian health workers said Israeli airstrikes killed at least 35 people Sunday and hit tents for displaced people in the southern Gaza city of Rafah, and “numerous” others were trapped in flaming debris.
articles.title: Palestinian medics say Israeli airstrikes kill 35 in Gaza's Rafah as displaced people are hit

articles.author: RAF CASERT
articles.description: BRUSSELS (AP) — Relations between the European Union and Israel took a nosedive on the eve of the diplomatic recognition of a Palestinian state by EU members Ireland and Spain, with Madrid suggesting sanctions should be considered against Israel for its continued attacks in the southern Gaza city of Rafah.
articles.title: EU-Israel relations take a nosedive as Spain, Ireland set to formally recognize a Palestinian state

articles.author: ROD McGUIRK
articles.description: MELBOURNE, Australia (AP) — A Papua New Guinea government official has told the United Nations more than 2,000 people were believed to have been buried alive by Friday's landslide and has formally asked for international help.
articles.title: Papua New Guinea says Friday's landslide buried more than 2,000 people and formally asks for help

articles.author: MICHAEL R. SISAK, JENNIFER PELTZ and JAKE OFFENHARTZ
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — After 22 witnesses, including a porn actor, tabloid publisher and White House insiders, testimony is over at Donald Trump’s criminal trial in New York.
articles.title: Here's what every key witness said at Donald Trump’s hush money trial. Closing arguments are coming

articles.author: HYUNG-JIN KIM and HUIZHONG WU
articles.description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — China’s premier agreed Monday to revive three-way cooperation with South Korea and Japan in the face of shared challenges, but issued a veiled rebuke against the two countries’ expanding security cooperation with the United States.
articles.title: China premier agrees on cooperation with Seoul, Tokyo but issues veiled rebuke against their US ties

articles.author: DIDI TANG
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Business is good at “the firm.”The eight-person team at the State Department is leading Washington's efforts to ease the economic blowback for countries targeted by China.It emerged in the scramble to help Lithuania during a spat with China over Taiwan two years ago.
articles.title: China has threatened trade with some countries after feuds. They're calling 'the firm' for help

articles.author: LORI HINNANT and VASILISA STEPANENKO
articles.description: FAR WESTERN UKRAINE (AP) — Precious few choices are available to Alexander, a 26-year-old Russian soldier, since his capture: Clothes, meals and the hours of his day are rigidly accounted for in the camp for prisoners of war.
articles.title: Russian POWs get to make phone calls home. Ukrainians don't. A growing movement wants that to change

articles.author: DANICA COTO
articles.description: PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti (AP) — For 12-year-old Juliana St. Vil, life begins every afternoon.She bounds out of the crowded shelter where she’s been sleeping on the concrete floor for 10 months, a smile on her face despite harsh surroundings.
articles.title: Forced to rebuild a life at 12, a Haitian girl joins thousands seeking an escape from gang violence

articles.author: JOSH FUNK
articles.description: OFFUTT AIR FORCE BASE, Neb. (AP) — Generations of American families have grown up not knowing exactly what happened to their loved ones who died while serving their country in World War II and other conflicts.
articles.title: Military labs do the detective work to identify soldiers decades after they died in World War II
